verses.verse: And when Balaam <S%H1109><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> that it pleased <S%H2895><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> to bless <S%H1288><s%> Israel, <S%H3478><s%> he went <S%H1980><s%> not, as at other times, <S%H6471><s%> to seek <S%H7125><s%> for enchantments, <S%H5172><s%> but he set <S%H7896><s%> his face <S%H6440><s%> toward <S%H413><s%> the wilderness. <S%H4057><s%>

And Balaam <S%H1109><s%> lifted <S%H5375><s%> up his eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and he saw <S%H7200><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> abiding <S%H7931><s%> in his tents according to their tribes; <S%H7626><s%> and the spirit <S%H7307><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> came <S%H1961><s%> on him.

And he took <S%H5375><s%> up his parable, <S%H4912><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> Balaam <S%H1109><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Beor <S%H1160><s%> has said, <S%H5002><s%> and the man <S%H1397><s%> whose eyes <S%H5869><s%> are open <S%H8365><s%> has said: <S%H5002><s%>

He has said, <S%H5002><s%> which <S%H834><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> the words <S%H561><s%> of God, <S%H410><s%> which saw <S%H2372><s%> the vision <S%H4236><s%> of the Almighty, <S%H7706><s%> falling <S%H5307><s%> into a trance, but having his eyes <S%H5869><s%> open: <S%H1540><s%>
How <S%H4100><s%> goodly <S%H2896><s%> are your tents, <S%H168><s%> O Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> and your tabernacles, <S%H4908><s%> O Israel! <S%H3478><s%>

As the valleys <S%H5158><s%> are they spread <S%H5186><s%> forth, as gardens <S%H1593><s%> by the river's <S%H5104><s%> side, as the trees of lign aloes <S%H174><s%> which the LORD <S%H3068><s%> has planted, <S%H5193><s%> and as cedar <S%H730><s%> trees beside <S%H5921><s%> the waters. <S%H4325><s%>

He shall pour <S%H5140><s%> the water <S%H4325><s%> out of his buckets, <S%H1805><s%> and his seed <S%H2233><s%> shall be in many <S%H7227><s%> waters, <S%H4325><s%> and his king <S%H4428><s%> shall be higher <S%H7311><s%> than Agag, <S%H90><s%> and his kingdom <S%H4438><s%> shall be exalted. <S%H5375><s%>

God <S%H410><s%> brought <S%H3318><s%> him forth <S%H4161><s%> out of Egypt; <S%H4714><s%> he has as it were the strength <S%H8443><s%> of an unicorn: <S%H7214><s%> he shall eat <S%H398><s%> up the nations <S%H1471><s%> his enemies, <S%H6862><s%> and shall break <S%H1633><s%> their bones, <S%H6106><s%> and pierce <S%H4272><s%> them through with his arrows. <S%H2671><s%>

He couched, <S%H3766><s%> he lay <S%H7901><s%> down <S%H7901><s%> as a lion, <S%H738><s%> and as a great <S%H3833><s%> lion: <S%H3833><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> shall stir <S%H6965><s%> him up? Blessed <S%H1288><s%> is he that blesses <S%H1288><s%> you, and cursed <S%H779><s%> is he that curses <S%H779><s%> you.

And Balak's <S%H1111><s%> anger <S%H639><s%> was kindled <S%H2734><s%> against <S%H413><s%> Balaam, <S%H1109><s%> and he smote <S%H5606><s%> his hands <S%H3709><s%> together: and Balak <S%H1111><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Balaam, <S%H1109><s%> I called <S%H7121><s%> you to curse <S%H6895><s%> my enemies, <S%H341><s%> and, behold, <S%H2009><s%> you have altogether blessed <S%H1288><s%> them these <S%H2088><s%> three <S%H7969><s%> times.

Therefore now <S%H6258><s%> flee <S%H1272><s%> you to your place: <S%H4725><s%> I thought <S%H559><s%> to promote <S%H3513><s%> you to great honor; <S%H3513><s%> but, see, <S%H2009><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> has kept <S%H4513><s%> you back <S%H4513><s%> from honor. <S%H3519><s%>

And Balaam <S%H1109><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Balak, <S%H1111><s%> Spoke <S%H1696><s%> I not also <S%H1571><s%> to your messengers <S%H4397><s%> which <S%H834><s%> you sent <S%H7971><s%> to me, saying, <S%H559><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> Balak <S%H1111><s%> would give <S%H5414><s%> me his house <S%H1004><s%> full <S%H4393><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%> and gold, <S%H2091><s%> I cannot <S%H3808><s%> <S%H3201><s%> go <S%H5674><s%> beyond <S%H5674><s%> the commandment <S%H6310><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%> either good <S%H2896><s%> or <S%H176><s%> bad <S%H7451><s%> of my own mind; <S%H3820><s%> but what <S%H834><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> said, <S%H1696><s%> that will I speak? <S%H1696><s%>

And now, <S%H6258><s%> behold, <S%H2005><s%> I go <S%H1980><s%> to my people: <S%H5971><s%> come <S%H3212><s%> therefore, and I will advertise <S%H3289><s%> you what <S%H834><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> people <S%H5971><s%> shall do <S%H6213><s%> to your people <S%H5971><s%> in the latter <S%H319><s%> days. <S%H3117><s%>

And he took <S%H5375><s%> up his parable, <S%H4912><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> Balaam <S%H1109><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Beor <S%H1160><s%> has said, <S%H5002><s%> and the man <S%H1397><s%> whose eyes <S%H5869><s%> are open <S%H8365><s%> has said: <S%H5002><s%>

He has said, <S%H5002><s%> which heard <S%H8085><s%> the words <S%H561><s%> of God, <S%H410><s%> and knew <S%H3045><s%> the knowledge <S%H1847><s%> of the most <S%H6944><s%> High, <S%H5945><s%> which saw <S%H2372><s%> the vision <S%H4236><s%> of the Almighty, <S%H7706><s%> falling <S%H5307><s%> into a trance, but having his eyes <S%H5869><s%> open: <S%H1540><s%>

I shall see <S%H7200><s%> him, but not now: <S%H6258><s%> I shall behold <S%H7789><s%> him, but not near: <S%H7126><s%> there shall come <S%H1869><s%> a Star <S%H3556><s%> out of Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> and a Scepter <S%H7626><s%> shall rise <S%H6965><s%> out of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> and shall smite <S%H4272><s%> the corners <S%H6285><s%> of Moab, <S%H4124><s%> and destroy <S%H6979><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the children <S%H1121><s%> of Sheth. <S%H8352><s%>

And Edom <S%H123><s%> shall be a possession, <S%H3424><s%> Seir <S%H8165><s%> also shall be a possession <S%H3424><s%> for his enemies; <S%H341><s%> and Israel <S%H3478><s%> shall do <S%H6213><s%> valiantly. <S%H2428><s%>
Out of Jacob <S%H3290><s%> shall come <S%H3381><s%> he that shall have dominion, <S%H7287><s%> and shall destroy <S%H6><s%> him that remains <S%H8300><s%> of the city. <S%H5892><s%>

And when he looked <S%H7200><s%> on <S%H5921><s%> Amalek, <S%H6002><s%> he took <S%H5375><s%> up his parable, <S%H4912><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> Amalek <S%H6002><s%> was the first <S%H7225><s%> of the nations; <S%H1471><s%> but his latter <S%H319><s%> end shall be that he perish <S%H8><s%> for ever. <S%H5703><s%>

And he looked <S%H7200><s%> on <S%H5921><s%> the Kenites, <S%H7017><s%> and took <S%H5375><s%> up his parable, <S%H4912><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> Strong <S%H386><s%> is your dwelling place, <S%H4186><s%> and you put <S%H7760><s%> your nest <S%H7064><s%> in a rock. <S%H5553><s%>
Nevertheless <S%H3588><s%> <S%H518><s%> the Kenite <S%H7014><s%> shall be wasted, <S%H1197><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> Asshur <S%H804><s%> shall carry <S%H7617><s%> you away captive. <S%H7617><s%>
And he took <S%H5375><s%> up his parable, <S%H4912><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> Alas, <S%H188><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> shall live <S%H2421><s%> when God <S%H410><s%> does <S%H7760><s%> this!

And ships <S%H6716><s%> shall come from the coast <S%H3027><s%> of Chittim, <S%H3794><s%> and shall afflict <S%H6031><s%> Asshur, <S%H804><s%> and shall afflict <S%H6031><s%> Eber, <S%H5677><s%> and he also <S%H1571><s%> shall perish <S%H8><s%> for ever. <S%H5703><s%>

And Balaam <S%H1109><s%> rose <S%H6965><s%> up, and went <S%H3212><s%> and returned <S%H7725><s%> to his place: <S%H4725><s%> and Balak <S%H1111><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> went <S%H1980><s%> his way. <S%H1870><s%>
